intro: Vrydagzynea buruensis var. tenera, commonly known as the Buru velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the island of Buru in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, tropical environments, often near water bodies or in swampy areas. It has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in nutrient-rich, waterlogged soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
